turns.content: For the last 8 years of his life, Galileo was under house arrest for espousing this man's theory
Galileo was under house arrest for the last 8 years of his life for espousing the theory of Copernicus, which stated that the Earth and other planets revolve around the Sun.
No. 2: 1912 Olympian; football star at Carlisle Indian School; 6 MLB seasons with the Reds, Giants & Braves
Jim Thorpe is a 1912 Olympian, football star at Carlisle Indian School, and had 6 MLB seasons with the Reds, Giants and Braves.
The city of Yuma in this state has a record average of 4,055 hours of sunshine each year
The city of Yuma in Arizona has a record average of 4,055 hours of sunshine each year.
In 1963, live on "The Art Linkletter Show", this company served its billionth burger
In 1963, live on "The Art Linkletter Show", McDonald's served its billionth burger.
Signer of the Dec. of Indep., framer of the Constitution of Mass., second President of the United States
John Adams is the signer of the Declaration of Independence, framer of the Constitution of Massachusetts, and the second President of the United States.
In the title of an Aesop fable, this insect shared billing with a grasshopper
In the title of an Aesop fable, "The Ant and the Grasshopper" the insect Ant shared billing with the Grasshopper.
Built in 312 B.C. to link Rome & the South of Italy, it's still in use today
The Appian Way, built in 312 B.C. to link Rome and the South of Italy, is still in use today.
No. 8: 30 steals for the Birmingham Barons; 2,306 steals for the Bulls

This is likely a reference to Michael Jordan, who played baseball for the Birmingham Barons in 1994 and had 30 steals. He is also known for his time as a basketball player for the Chicago Bulls, where he recorded 2,306 steals in his career.
